output_list.criticism: The addToken function allows arbitrary increase of tokens, allowing arbitrary transfers. This can lead to unauthorized token transfers and potentially loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setExchangeRate function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized changes in the exchange rate, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setICORunning function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized changes in the ICO status, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setTransfer function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized changes in the transfer status, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The addInitialInvestor function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized addition of initial investors, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.

The setEarlyInvestorExchangeRate function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized changes in the early investor exchange rate, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setStartDate function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized changes in the ICO start date, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setStartRefund function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized changes in the start refund status, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The finalize function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized finalization of the ICO, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
The refund function can be called by anyone, which can lead to unauthorized refunds, potentially leading to loss of funds for the contract owner.
